data.title: Adams County Government
data.text:
Written Comments

Members of the Public may submit written comments on any matter within the Boardâ€™s subject matter jurisdiction through the agenda link below and the online comment system. The link is available at the time the agenda is posted, by 4:30 P.M. the Friday prior to the public hearing and will close at 4:30 P.M. the Monday prior to the public hearing. Click the conversation bubble below in the "Options" column to open the comment window.

Archives

Click here for archived BOCC meetings prior to October 11, 2022.

Click here for archived Planning Commission, Board of Adjustment, and Liquor and Marijuana Licensing Authority Board meetings.

Communication Accommodations

Adams County Government will generally, upon request, provide appropriate aids and services leading to effective communication for qualified persons with disabilities so they can participate equally in its programs, services, and activities, including qualified sign language interpreters and other ways of making information and communications accessible to people who have speech, hearing, or vision impairments. Anyone requiring an auxiliary aid, assistive listening equipment, alternative format, or other services for effective communication to participate in an Adams County program, service, or activity (such as a public meeting) should make the request as soon as possible but no later than 48 hours before the scheduled event.

To request a communication accommodation online, please complete and submit the Auxiliary Aids and Services Request Form no later than 48 hours before the scheduled event. For additional support email the Adams County ADA/504 Coordinator or call 720.523.6325 for assistance.

Adams County Government does not discriminate based on disability in its programs, services, activities and employment practices. Click here for Adams County's complete guide to accessibility.
